summary:
The Security Council:

* Calls on parties to overcome mutual mistrust and revitalize the peace process (para 11, 12)
* Urges parties to implement confidence-building measures agreed in Yalta (2001) and consider a fourth conference (para 12)
* Reminds parties to refrain from actions impeding the peace process (para 13)
* Stresses the need for progress on refugees and internally displaced persons, and their return in secure conditions (para 14, 15)
* Reaffirms the inalienable right of refugees and IDPs to return to their homes (para 15)
* Calls on the Abkhaz side to protect returnees and facilitate the return of displaced population (para 16)
* Welcomes the UN Development Programme mission to the Gali region and its report (para 17)
* Urges parties to implement recommendations of the joint assessment mission (para 18)
* Welcomes the deployment of a civilian police component as part of UNOMIG (para 19)
* Calls on the Abkhaz side to improve law enforcement and address lack of instruction in mother tongue for ethnic Georgians (para 20)
* Urges parties to dissociate themselves from militant rhetoric and support for military options (para 21)
* Condemns violations of the Moscow Agreement (1994) and calls for their implementation (para 22)
* Welcomes relative calm in Kodori Valley and urges parties to resolve the situation peacefully (para 23)
* Deplores deterioration in security environment in Gali sector (para 24)
* Welcomes Quadripartite meeting and signing of protocols on security issues (para 25)
* Calls on parties to improve security for UNOMIG and CIS peacekeeping force patrols (para 26)
* Underlines parties' responsibility to provide security and ensure freedom of movement for international personnel (para 27)
* Urges parties to identify and bring to justice those responsible for the shooting down of a UNOMIG helicopter (para 28)
* Extends the mandate of UNOMIG until 31 July 2004 (para 29)
* Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed and report on the situation (para 30)
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 31)
